page.title: 02Introducing the Peak Park
page.content: It stands latticed yet solid, at the junction of the road leading back to Froggatt Edge and on to the winding Sheffield to Castleton road. The latter promises the delights of inspiring views as it meanders toward Hathersage, and of the gentle brooklands bubbling down through Padley gorge toward Grindleford station. For ease of reference we have named our area Longshaw, now a Country Park owned by the National Trust, of which more is described later. The Surprise, so called because of the exciting views and vistas, is where most of the visitors converge, with many self made car parks having eroded the roadside grassland. Walking, photographing and picnicking are common but time and weather dictate how long visitors stay in this area.
